Here here. It's getting more like a dictatorship everyday in this country, the Tories have never listened to the voters, everything they do is for their own convenience and not for the good of the country.( after all that's why they get elected isn't it, for the good of the people and country) the way May is going about this is like a bull in a china shop. People wanted their sovereignty back but I'd like to know who stole it in the first place as this government is taking it away every day! It's about time people woke up!

British Empire 2.0? Really Now!!! Today March 13 2017 is Commonwealth of Nation Day and I dare anyone in the Commonwealth to tell me what benefits being a member of this useless and worthless organization has contributed to our lives in all these years. In fact I would go even further to ask, what are the benefits of having the Queen of England and the British Monarchy as Head of State in our country? How does this contribute to our daily lives, what does it bring to the table of Nation Building?

There are now members of the British Government who are throwing around the term and describing Post Brexit Britain as “British Empire 2.0”. That Britain will reengage the forgotten Commonwealth of Nations once again to serve British interest. Because serving British interest above our own is the only purpose we seem to serve and have always served and why we were placed on this earth. That is the only thing we mean to Britain.

The Commonwealth of Nations was created so Britain could package and store its unwanted colonies for later use, in case of emergency break glass. The Commonwealth of Nations, was a grand idea until multicultural, multiracial Mud coloured people of the Commonwealth turned up at British ports and started walking up and down the British high streets like they own the place. It was then that the Commonwealth had to go, it was River of Blood time and as such the Commonwealth of Nations was The First Brexit.

Now imagine my shock and horror when during the whole Brexit debate various pro-leave campaigners, far right leaders and racist Neo-Nazis, xenophobic hate mongers started throw about the idea that Britain still have its Multicultural and Multiracial Commonwealth to fall back on and do trade with. Just what is the Commonwealth to you? Something that you put aside for a rainy day, just in case your dream of a White European Empire Failed? And now they are throwing around the term of British Empire 2.0. To the members of the Commonwealth When are we going to start telling these damn people to go to hell! Or are you guys looking forward to the British Empire 2.0 like a battered wife going back to a brutal husband expecting love but getting more of the same.
Hear! Hear!
Well said!

Well said! 
As a Brit I have often been ashamed of our imperial past. 
The "good old days" as some people think - yeah, like when we invented concentration camps during the Boer War! 
It was a disgusting way to carry on!
You mean "post-Brexit England" surely? Looks like the Celtic nations are about to "take back control"...

This is obviously not only the idea of some in the UK regarding the Commonwealth, but also the EU. Many of the Leave campaign have a strong desire to destroy the EU and then negotiate bilaterally with single countries ("this is how we always do such things").
Some people even argue they wouldn't need trade agreements with Australia, Canada or New Zealand as the British Queen is still their head of state too.
It's about turning back time. But the strategie of splitting and dividing and then take from the rest what ever they can get won't succeed this time. This is not the 18th or 19th century, and they won't have to deal with "third world" countries.

How would it be democratic if the goverment alone makes all the brexit related executive decisions, with parliament only having a sort of consultative role and no real say at all; if you wanted sovereignty back, surly that mean parliament is to decide?! All UK citizen who did not want (a hard) brexit, must still have the right to have their views taken into account.
The Tories have a majority. Even with a 'meaningful' vote, they'd ram it through.
..I think, if that majority is a slim enough there is a chance; it still has to go through a 2nd round in HoL.
Hypocrisy is broken

This  is the  problem,  what do  we the  public want them  to  do?  Do  we  vote and  let them  get  on  with  it? Or  do  we demand a  referendum every  time s  constitutional treaty or  something that's  gonna  affect us the  people in  drastic  way,  is considered  by  government?

They do, and talk of Theresa May as an unelected leader is nonsense; it is her party's right to have whichever leader they choose. What she does not have is her own mandate. British people (foolishly) elected the conservatives on a 'cast iron' promise not to leave the single market, whatever the referendum result. Looking at all of their own manifesto promises this government is breaking, it  is being duplicitous and self-serving. In addition she is eroding the power of parliament, to rule directly. that is not just undemocratic, it is anti-democratic. The saddest part is that if she asked the country to elect her on a hard Brexit manifesto, she would win that too. This is not a little squabble about Europe, it is an issue of destroying the principle of government by the people, for the people, completely. That, though not quite fascist, is dictatorial. We are not entering a phase of politics we can be proud of. We are entering a phase of authoritarian rule-by-uncontested law. Parliament has just watched manifesto promises being broken, and voted to not give itself a vote in government. A slippery slope with grim consequences for most of the population, who seem to lap it up and ask to be shafted with no power to respond.

"If MPs overturn both amendments, peers will debate for a couple of hours, with the tone taken by Davis viewed as important: if he is seen as having been respectful of their role, they are more likely to accept the supremacy of the Commons."

Is that all it takes for the House of Lords to back down? That Davis is seen to be respectful of their role? How pathetic and spineless is that? Good grief.

What a sad sad time it is... no matter how you look at this it will not be good for the future of the UK and if immigration was the most important aspect of all of this. Then smart leaders should have found a better way to deal with it than potentially destroying our trading relationship with Europe.

Hey, but let's lecture Scotland about leaving their biggest market.

The hypocrisy and incompetence of May is astounding.

Of course they'll back down. Very few of them have the stomach for the wrath of Murdoch's press baying for their blood and screaming 'enemies of the people' etc etc. I'm very much afraid the die is cast. Fasten your seat belts and hope for the best.

All labour had to do is to tell "the people"  that the referendum is an advisory and it's in the best interest of the country that UK remained a member of the EU. Stop this madness. Brexit will cause long lasting economic harm to the UK. :( why are you doing this??

There was a court ruling on parliament having a necessary say on triggering Art.50. I'd think it sort of automatically extends to the contract at the end of the 2 years negotiation: that final act needs to be ratified by parliament to be implementable. 
Just imagine a government joining EU without ratification by its parliament.... unimaginable. 
So in order to get a version that is somewhat guaranteed to find agreement with the MPs, May should of course put updates on the table whenever those make sense.

Article 50 will happen this week. However the SNP have provided the EU with an ace card. They have threw a spanner in the Tory plans. As an Associate member of the EU, Scotland have indicated they do not want to leave. This will leave the EU telling UK's Brexit team, lets have a favourable deal to all, or the EU will assist in the break up of the UK. I think the SNP have assured a much softer Brexit than what the right wing Tory Party wanted. In my opinion the SNP were informed of the best time to make this announcement.

The Tories want a breakup of the UK . Remove Scotlands MP'S from Westminster and you virtually guarantee perpetual Tory rule. Scottish Labour are dead but a resurgent Labour party in Scotland could hold the balance of power at Westminster .
But are EU nationals already here going to stay once our workers/human rights have been taken away?

The  thing  is  we've  either  got  a  democracy  or  we  don't? The  democratic  vote  was to  leave the  EU,  like  it  or  not. Yet what's shocking  is the  government chooses  to  ignore our  democratic  rights when  it  suits  their  purposes. So  we've  still   got  dictators in  office.
